ratings.comment: She does not seem like the nicest professor out there, but she is helpful in office hours. She knows the materials really well, however I had to put a decent amount of effort to keep up with the course. For a professor in STEM field she has done a pretty good job.
best cs lecture the most comprehensible
Take other Professors!!

Prof. Morrow's class is a set of online lectures with in-class exercises. There are 5 tests plus a final. Every week there are also readings, but I did not find them to be necessary for success in class. I found the class to be very easy, and if you do well you do not even have to take the final. Teaches you what you need to know as well.

She goes fast during the videos, but just pause during her video lessons, and you'll do fine. Keep a focused mind while listening, and actually do the work. Good amount of workload for a 2 credit class. Very concise but fast in video lectures, but if you go to her office hours, she'll make you a  computing wizard.

She is a joke. You have to watch videos before coming to class which she records herself. But she talks really fast making it hard to understand/grasp the concept(and there is plenty) because of the speed. It will give you a headache. She is the meanest Assistant professor I have ever met. She is bored and looking for ways to make your life hell.

Great format to the course - very straightforward grading criteria and grade components. Assessments and homework assignments got progressively more difficult throughout the course.  I have gone in to office hours several times, and pr. Morrow was very helpful - if you show effort, the prof will be glad to help you understand the concepts.

Most well run course I've ever taken.  Brief and extremely clear pre-class videos.  In-class exercises are easy but great at helping you learn.  Exams are easy and fair too.  Won't have to take final.  Some reviews say she's mean.  I've never seen that, but haven't had to talk with her much because class is so easy and clear.  I learned A LOT too.

Awesome class and excellent professor, definitely recommend taking it even for those who are just doing comp sci. Nicely organized exercises,concepts not hard and office hours extremely helpful, KMorrow is making it really useful tool for connecting all the important dots and topics. 2 midterms are fair,final is pretty tricky(cumulative) but doable
She is a little strict so some people get off on the wrong foot with her but she is a great teacher

She is probably one of the worst professors I have had at Madison.  She is not encouraging & is not helpful/mean if you go into office hours to talk to her.  Her videos are confusing and she expects you to know everything from the videos going into the WISCEL activities.  I would not recommend this professor.

At least for me, she's not that good. Not straightforward when answering questions. Make this course as a perfectly self-study one. Short lecture video covers many concepts that are hard to digest. The sad thing is that though you watched the video few times, you still got confused for Wiscel. This is a 2-credit intro course. She makes it difficult

She's honestly the worst professor I've ever had at UW Madison. It seems as though she prefers chiding her students to helping. All of the TAs also have this attitude. This makes learning more difficult. Also, the class requires too much work for a two-credit. I'm incredibly surprised by the amount of positivity on this page. Would not recommend.

If you ever need help with anything, be sure to go talk to the other Morrow. She is easily the meanest teacher I have ever encountered at the University, and does a much better job making the student feel inadequate than providing any help whatsoever. Will never take another class she teaches. Period.
Katherine Morrow is a great professor.  If you are ever at a loss she is very helpful with questions.  Online lectures are informative but fast-paced

She taught the class in wis-cell which was cool. Definitely helped having a smart partner next to me to work with. When asking a questions her and the TA's do a good job making you understand the material to figure out answer... also read the textbook, all the material is in there

Best professor I've had. Both the Morrows have teaching down to a science. The WisCEL exercises and lecture videos were essential to passing the class. Grading criteria was very clear cut. I never picked up the textbook and never did any extra work other than what was assigned and studying for tests. TL;DR - She actually TEACHES her students.

WisCEL exercises were helpful in learning course material and encouraged participation. She makes it very clear what you need to know to do well in the course. She can explain things well and holds enough office hours so you can get extra help if you need it.
She's pretty clear in explaining concepts during the lecturediscussion and is helpful during the in-class exercises. Exams and assessments were fair.
Very good professor. She knows the material as well as how to teach it. Also, it is clear she cares that her students learn the material.

They've switched to online lectures with a group wiscel session. She was extremely good at writing the mandatory quizzes that we took each week and at helping out with any questions that we had. Very good at what she had to do for the format. I highly recommend her.

Very effectively taught class. WisCEL sessions are a great learning tool and fun, too. Prof. Morrow (formerly Compton) might give off an apprehensive vibe, but she's anything but an out-to-get-you professor. Very helpful, very smart, very good teacher.
Written HWs are not so bad.. Office hours are really helpful! Applied HWs usually take several hours for pre-demo, but demo and post-demos are not that bad. Exams are fair and not too hard.

This is a very tough course. There is a lot of work and lengthy projects. Compton is the best professor you can have for it. Class can be dull sometimes. If you don't understand anything, go to her office hours immediately. She's very helpful and is very willing to assist you. She's easy-going and quick at grading and very personable.

Amazing Professor! Answers e-mails with supernatural speed and clarity. Extraordinary ability to explain material in understandable manner. Extreme patient when you ask for help. Simply put she really cares about her students! Easily one of the best professors I have ever and will ever have!
The class was actually pretty interesting.  The exams were of reasonable difficulty.  The labs were obnoxious.  Many of them required prelabs that took several hours to complete.

Lectures are boring and there is no one good place to go for notes. You have the board, powerpoints, worksheets, extra handouts and the book which is pretty useless. I found wikipedia to be my most common reference. The lab projects are a ****. Make sure you sit next to someone dependable the first lab because you'll be stuck with them.

Not a terribly difficult class.  Lectures are very boring, although I can't think of how to make it much more exciting.  I was less than thrilled about a requirement added to our project which was not mentioned in the specification, in email, or in the project faq.  The first midterm was too long for the amount of time given.

Very harsh nitpicky grading, wastes time on long unnecessary examples, and has a highly soporific voice. That being said, the class moves slow enough to learn everything, which is a rare pleasure for an ECE class, and she explains things very well. You'll learn a lot from her, and you'll learn it well, but you won't get the grade you deserve.
No Comments
Reused old PowerPoint slides from many years ago.  I wasn't happy with that.  But I got a better grade in the class then expected.
